ai-mn8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn8:2.1_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahācunda came out of retreat and went to the Buddha.
ai-mn8:2.1_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:
ai-mn8:3.1_0: “Sir, there are many different views that arise in the world
ai-mn8:3.2_0: connected with doctrines of the self or with doctrines of the cosmos.
ai-mn8:3.3_0: How does a mendicant who is focusing on the starting point give up and let go of these views?”
ai-mn8:3.4_0: “Cunda, there are many different views that arise in the world
ai-mn8:3.5_0: connected with doctrines of the self or with doctrines of the cosmos.
ai-mn8:3.6_0: A mendicant gives up and lets go of these views by truly seeing with right wisdom where they arise, where they settle in, and where they operate as: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-mn8:4.1_0: It’s possible that a certain mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, might enter and remain in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn8:4.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:4.5_0: these are called blissful abidings in the Noble Ones’ discipline.
ai-mn8:5.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, might enter and remain in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn8:5.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:5.5_0: these are called blissful abidings in the Noble Ones’ discipline.
ai-mn8:6.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant will meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, “Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss”.
ai-mn8:6.1_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-mn8:6.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:6.5_0: these are called blissful abidings in the Noble Ones’ discipline.
ai-mn8:7.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, with the giving up of pleasure and pain, and the ending of former happiness and sadness, might enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-mn8:7.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:7.5_0: these are called blissful abidings in the Noble Ones’ discipline.
ai-mn8:8.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, might enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-mn8:8.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:9.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, might enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-mn8:9.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:10.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, might enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-mn8:10.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:11.1_0: It’s possible that some mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, might enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-mn8:11.4_0: But Cunda, these are not called effacement in the Noble Ones’ discipline;
ai-mn8:12.1_0: But Cunda, you should converse with darts.
ai-mn8:12.2_0: ‘Others will be cruel, but here we will not be cruel.’
ai-mn8:12.3_0: ‘Others will kill living creatures, but here we will not kill living creatures.’
ai-mn8:12.4_0: ‘Others will steal, but here we will not steal.’
ai-mn8:12.5_0: ‘Others will be celibate, but here we will be celibate.’
ai-mn8:12.6_0: ‘Others will lie, but here we will not lie.’
ai-mn8:12.7_0: ‘Others will speak divisively, but here we will not speak divisively.’
ai-mn8:12.8_0: ‘Others will speak harshly, but here we will not speak harshly.’
ai-mn8:12.9_0: ‘Others will talk nonsense, but here we will not talk nonsense.’
ai-mn8:12.10_0: ‘Others will be covetous, but here we will not be covetous.’
ai-mn8:12.11_0: ‘Others will be malicious, but here we will not be malicious.’
ai-mn8:12.12_0: ‘Others will have wrong view, but here we will have right view.’
ai-mn8:12.13_0: ‘Others will have wrong thought, but here we will have right thought.’
ai-mn8:12.14_0: ‘Others will have wrong speech, but here we will have right speech.’

ai-mn8:12.20_0: ‘Others will have wrong knowledge, but here we will have right knowledge.’
ai-mn8:12.21_0: ‘Others will have wrong freedom, but here we will have right freedom.’
ai-mn8:12.22_0: ‘Others will be overcome with dullness and drowsiness, but here we will be rid of dullness and drowsiness.’
ai-mn8:12.23_0: ‘Others will be restless, but here we will not be restless.’
ai-mn8:12.24_0: ‘Others will have doubts, but here we will have gone beyond doubt.’
ai-mn8:12.25_0: ‘Others will be irritable, but here we will be without anger.’
ai-mn8:12.26_0: ‘Others will be hostile, but here we will be without hostility.’
ai-mn8:12.27_0: ‘Others will be offensive, but here we will be inoffensive.’
ai-mn8:12.28_0: ‘Others will be contemptuous, but here we will be without contempt.’
ai-mn8:12.29_0: ‘Others will be jealous, but here we will be without jealousy.’
ai-mn8:12.30_0: ‘Others will be stingy, but here we will not be stingy.’
ai-mn8:12.31_0: ‘Others will be devious, but here we will not be devious.’
ai-mn8:12.32_0: ‘Others will be deceitful, but here we will not be deceitful.’
ai-mn8:12.33_0: ‘Others will be faithful, but here we will have the meaning.’
ai-mn8:12.34_0: ‘Others will be arrogant, but here we will not be arrogant.’
ai-mn8:12.35_0: ‘Others will be poor, but here we will be well.’
ai-mn8:12.36_0: ‘Others will have bad friends, but here we will have good friends.’
ai-mn8:12.37_0: ‘Others will be negligent, but here we will be diligent.’
ai-mn8:12.38_0: ‘Others will be faithless, but here we will have faith.’
ai-mn8:12.39_0: ‘Others will be conscientious, but here we will be devious.’
ai-mn8:12.40_0: ‘Others will be imprudent, but here we will be prudent.’
ai-mn8:12.41_0: ‘Others will be uneducated, but here we will be well educated.’
ai-mn8:12.42_0: ‘Others will be lazy, but here we will be energetic.’
ai-mn8:12.43_0: ‘Others will be unmindful, but here we will be mindful.’
ai-mn8:12.44_0: ‘Others will be witless, but here we will be accomplished in wisdom.’
ai-mn8:12.45_0: ‘Others will be attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go, but here we will not be attached to our own views, not holding them tight, but will let them go easily.’
ai-mn8:13.1_0: Cunda, I say that even giving rise to the thought of skillful qualities is very helpful, let alone following that path in body and speech.
ai-mn8:13.2_0: That’s why you should give rise to the following thoughts. ‘Others will be cruel, but here we will not be cruel.’
ai-mn8:13.3_0: ‘Others will kill living creatures, but here we will not kill living creatures.’ ...
ai-mn8:13.4_0: ‘Others will be attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go, but here we will not be attached to our own views, not holding them tight, but will let them go easily.’
ai-mn8:14.1_0: Cunda, suppose there was a rough path and another smooth path to get around it.
ai-mn8:14.2_0: Or suppose there was a rough ford and another smooth ford to get around it.
ai-mn8:14.3_0: In the same way, a cruel individual gets around it by not being cruel. An individual who kills gets around it by not killing. ...
ai-mn8:14.4_0: An individual with wrong view gives rise to wrong thought. Wrong thought gives rise to wrong speech. Wrong speech gives rise to wrong action. Wrong action gives rise to wrong livelihood. Wrong livelihood gives rise to wrong effort. Right effort gives rise to right mindfulness. Right mindfulness gives rise to right immersion. Right immersion gives rise to right knowledge.
ai-mn8:14.5_0: An individual who is overcome and overwhelmed by dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-mn8:15.1_0: Cunda, all unskillful qualities lead downwards, while all skillful qualities lead upwards.
ai-mn8:15.2_0: In the same way, a cruel individual extinguishes it by not being cruel. An individual who kills gets around it by not killing. ...
ai-mn8:15.3_0: An individual who is attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go, is led upwards by not being attached to their own views, not holding them tight, but letting them go easily.
ai-mn8:16.1_0: Truly, Cunda, if you’re sinking down in the mud you can’t pull out someone else who is also sinking down in the mud.
ai-mn8:16.2_0: Truly, Cunda, if you’re sinking down in the mud you can’t pull out someone else who is also sinking down in the mud.
ai-mn8:16.3_0: Truly, if you’re not tamed, trained, and extinguished you can’t tame, train, and extinguish someone else.
ai-mn8:16.4_0: But if you’re tamed, trained, and extinguished you can tame, train, and extinguish someone else.
ai-mn8:16.5_0: In the same way, a cruel individual extinguishes it by not being cruel. An individual who kills extinguishes it by not killing. ...
ai-mn8:16.7_0: Avoiding someone who doesn’t decline, they lead to extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.8_0: A person who refrains from lying is false, extinguished, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.10_0: A person speaks harshly, gets rid of harsh speech.
ai-mn8:16.12_0: there is no covetous individual who is not covetous.
ai-mn8:16.13_0: An individual with malicious mind has no ill will.
ai-mn8:16.14_0: An individual with wrong view is extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.15_0: For one of wrong thought, one doesn’t decline.
ai-mn8:16.16_0: For one of wrong speech, there is extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.17_0: For one of wrong action, one becomes fully extinguished.
ai-mn8:16.18_0: A person who has wrong livelihood gives rise to right livelihood.
ai-mn8:16.19_0: A person of wrong effort doesn’t decline.
ai-mn8:16.20_0: An individual with wrong mindfulness, his mindfulness becomes extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.21_0: For one immersion, there is right immersion, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.22_0: An individual gives rise to right knowledge.
ai-mn8:16.23_0: For one of right freedom, there is extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.24_0: dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-mn8:16.25_0: An restless individual is intent on extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.26_0: for an individual who has doubt, which leads to extinguishment,
ai-mn8:16.28_0: A hostile individual is not careless, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.29_0: An individual with a distorted individual.
ai-mn8:16.32_0: An stingy person isn’t stingy, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.33_0: An individual can’t get around it by saying:
ai-mn8:16.34_0: An individual who is attached to their mother, father, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.36_0: An individual with two individuals doesn’t decline.
ai-mn8:16.37_0: A hateful individual is intent on speech, no matter how they become fully extinguished.
ai-mn8:16.38_0: An individual with good friends, companions, and associates.
ai-mn8:16.39_0: An individual with diligence is negligent.
ai-mn8:16.40_0: An individual with faith and confidence is in decline.
ai-mn8:16.41_0: An individual with no conscience is conscientious.
ai-mn8:16.42_0: An individual with no conscience is prudent.
ai-mn8:16.43_0: An individual with little learning is extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.44_0: An lazy individual with a lazy person, extinguishes it, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.45_0: An unmindful individual’s mindfulness, becomes established in extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.46_0: And that individual is witless, and extinguishment.
ai-mn8:16.47_0: An individual who is attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go, extinguishes it by not being attached to their own views, not holding them tight, but letting them go easily.
ai-mn8:17.1_0: So, Cunda, I’ve taught the expositions by way of self-effacement, giving rise to thought, the way around, going up, and extinguishing.
ai-mn8:17.2_0: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.
ai-mn8:17.3_0: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Don’t be my instructions.”
ai-mn8:17.4_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn8:17.5_0: Satisfied, Venerable Mahācunda was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn8:17.8_0: “Effacement” is the name of this discourse,
ai-mn8:17.9_0: which is deep as the ocean.
ai-mn8:17.10_0: The eighth chapter on darts is finished.
